name: Climate-Related Financial Risk Assessment
description: A multidisciplinary field integrating climate science, financial modeling, and risk management to evaluate the economic impacts of climate change on investments, insurance, and financial portfolios. This includes scenario-based forecasting, stress testing, and valuation adjustments for assets exposed to extreme weather, sea-level rise, and temperature shifts.

name: Training and Capacity Development in Education and Workforce
description: A comprehensive framework focused on building skills, knowledge, and competencies in individuals and institutions through tailored training programs, mentorship, curriculum design, and continuous professional development. Emphasizes equity, accessibility, and relevance to emerging job markets and societal needs.
keywords: teacher training in the United States

name: Multi-Analytical Archaeological Approach
description: An integrated methodology combining geophysical surveys, chemical analysis, radiometric dating, and digital modeling to reconstruct past human activities, environmental conditions, and cultural practices from archaeological sites with high spatial and temporal resolution.

name: Prolonged Exposure and Health Impacts
description: A research domain examining the physiological, psychological, and behavioral consequences of extended exposure to environmental stressors, including noise, pollution, extreme temperatures, and occupational hazards, with a focus on chronic disease and resilience.

name: Muscle Health in Older Adults
description: A specialized field investigating the physiological mechanisms of muscle degeneration, exercise-induced benefits, and nutritional strategies to maintain sarcopenia, mobility, and functional independence in aging populations.

name: Bacterial Infection Treatment and Antimicrobial Strategies
description: A rapidly evolving domain focused on developing novel antimicrobial therapies, including phage therapy, antimicrobial resistance (AMR) mitigation, and targeted delivery systems, to combat persistent and drug-resistant bacterial infections.

name: Freezing Temperatures and Cryogenic Systems
description: A domain exploring the effects and applications of low-temperature environments, including cryogenic storage, material behavior, biological preservation, and energy systems, in both natural and engineered settings.

name: Active Sensing Technologies and Real-Time Monitoring
description: The development and deployment of autonomous, intelligent sensors capable of detecting, analyzing, and responding to environmental, biological, and physical changes in real time across diverse ecosystems and urban environments.

name: Simple Analytical Platforms for Point-of-Care Diagnostics
description: A focus on developing low-cost, portable, and user-friendly analytical devices for rapid detection of diseases, toxins, or environmental contaminants in field or community settings without requiring sophisticated infrastructure.

name: Automated Teaching Assistants and AI-Driven Education
description: The integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning into educational systems to provide personalized tutoring, adaptive learning pathways, automated grading, and real-time feedback to students and instructors.

name: Room Temperature Detection and Thermal Sensing
description: A specialized field focused on the development of highly sensitive, low-power, and cost-effective sensors for measuring temperature and thermal gradients in ambient, biological, and industrial environments at room temperature.

name: Transgenerational Phenotyping and Epigenetic Inheritance
description: A cutting-edge field studying how environmental exposures and genetic factors influence phenotypic traits across generations through epigenetic modifications, including DNA methylation and histone regulation.

name: Biological Feed Development and Sustainable Nutrition
description: The design and optimization of plant- and microbial-based feeds to improve animal health, reduce environmental impact, and enhance food security through sustainable, low-emission, and nutrient-efficient formulations.

name: Intelligent Polymers and Responsive Materials
description: Materials engineered to respond dynamically to stimuli such as temperature, pH, light, or mechanical stress, with applications in drug delivery, self-healing systems, and adaptive engineering structures.

name: Solid-State Metal Recycling and Circular Economy
description: A sustainable technology pathway focused on recovering and reprocessing metals from electronic waste, end-of-life vehicles, and industrial byproducts using solid-state methods to minimize environmental impact and energy use.

name: Corrosion Prediction Models and Material Durability
description: The use of computational and experimental methods to predict and prevent material degradation due to corrosion in infrastructure, pipelines, and industrial systems, with a focus on early warning and mitigation.

name: Plant Sensing and Environmental Monitoring
description: The integration of sensors and AI to monitor plant health, stress responses, and growth patterns in real time, enabling precision agriculture and early detection of disease or nutrient deficiencies.

name: On-Site Chemical Processing and Field Analysis
description: A field focused on enabling chemical analysis, synthesis, and treatment at remote or field locations without requiring laboratory infrastructure, supporting environmental monitoring, agriculture, and emergency response.

name: CO2 Capture and Carbon Management
description: A comprehensive approach to capturing, storing, and utilizing carbon dioxide from industrial and atmospheric sources to mitigate climate change and support carbon-negative technologies.

name: Gas-Phase Reaction Engineering and Catalysis
description: The design and optimization of chemical reactions in gaseous environments, including catalytic processes for fuel production, pollution control, and industrial synthesis, with emphasis on efficiency and scalability.

name: Archaeological Diagnostics and Digital Reconstruction
description: The use of advanced imaging, spectroscopy, and computational tools to diagnose and reconstruct ancient materials, structures, and human activities, combining traditional fieldwork with digital modeling.

name: Actin Dynamics and Cellular Mechanics
description: A cell biology field studying the structural and functional dynamics of actin filaments in cell motility, division, and signaling, with implications for disease and tissue engineering.

name: Chemical Biology of Mitochondria and Metabolism
description: A discipline investigating the biochemical pathways, signaling networks, and regulatory mechanisms within mitochondria that govern energy production, oxidative stress, and cellular health.

name: Job Market Design and Economic Inclusion
description: A policy and economic framework for designing labor markets that promote equity, access, and mobility, particularly for underrepresented groups, through targeted interventions and skill development.

name: Multiple Moving Objects and Tracking Systems
description: A domain focused on detecting, tracking, and predicting the movement of multiple dynamic entities—such as vehicles, animals, or people—using sensor fusion, AI, and computer vision in complex environments.

name: Co-Stimulatory Molecules and Immune Regulation
description: A field in immunology studying the role of co-stimulatory signals in activating or suppressing immune responses, with applications in cancer immunotherapy and autoimmune disease treatment.

name: Transport Service Providers and Urban Mobility
description: An analysis of transport systems, service delivery, and policy design to improve efficiency, equity, and sustainability in urban and rural mobility, including public transit, cycling, and shared mobility.

name: Direct-Detection Technologies in Physics and Sensing
description: A core technology area focused on detecting physical phenomena (e.g., light, radiation, particles) without amplification or indirect measurement, enabling high-fidelity, real-time data acquisition.

name: Materials Design and Nanoscale Engineering
description: The systematic design of new materials at the atomic and nanoscale level to achieve desired properties such as strength, conductivity, or biocompatibility, using computational modeling and experimental synthesis.

name: Copper Recovery and Critical Mineral Enrichment
description: A specialized process for extracting and purifying copper and other critical metals from ores, electronic waste, and industrial byproducts to support green technology and national security.

name: Democratic Fragility and Political Resilience
description: A research field analyzing the structural and institutional vulnerabilities of democracies, including electoral integrity, public trust, and policy responsiveness, with a focus on resilience and reform.

name: Immunotherapeutic Applications and Cancer Treatment
description: The development and deployment of therapies that harness or modulate the immune system to detect and destroy cancer cells, including checkpoint inhibitors and CAR-T cell therapies.

name: Gene Regulatory Network Modeling and Systems Biology
description: A computational approach to modeling how genes interact and regulate each other to control cellular processes, with applications in disease, development, and synthetic biology.

name: Ocular Immunology and Eye Disease Mechanisms
description: A specialized field studying immune responses in the eye, including autoimmune disorders like uveitis and the role of immune cells in retinal diseases and inflammation.

name: Occupational Skills and Workforce Development
description: A domain focused on identifying, developing, and certifying the skills required for modern and emerging industries, including digital, green, and health sectors.

name: Groundwater Contamination and Remediation
description: The detection, assessment, and mitigation of pollutants in groundwater, including heavy metals, pesticides, and industrial chemicals, using advanced monitoring and treatment technologies.

name: Higher Education Expansion and Institutional Innovation
description: A policy and educational domain focused on scaling access to higher education, improving quality, and integrating digital and interdisciplinary learning models.

name: Novel Detection Technologies and Sensing Innovation
description: The development of next-generation sensors and analytical tools for detecting biological, chemical, or environmental hazards with high sensitivity, specificity, and speed.

name: Treatment Guidelines and Clinical Decision Support
description: A field focused on developing evidence-based, dynamic treatment protocols for diseases and conditions, supported by AI, data analytics, and real-world clinical outcomes.

name: Curriculum Modeling and Educational Transformation
description: A process of designing, simulating, and evaluating curricula to align with learning outcomes, technological advances, and societal needs, using data-driven and adaptive frameworks.

name: Hospitals and Health System Optimization
description: A domain focused on improving hospital operations, patient outcomes, staff wellbeing, and resource allocation through data analytics, automation, and process redesign.

name: Visual Attention and Cognitive Processing
description: A neuroscience and psychology field studying how humans perceive, focus, and interpret visual information, with applications in AI, design, and user experience.

name: Resource Management Algorithms and Optimization
description: The use of computational models to allocate, monitor, and optimize the use of natural and human resources across sectors such as energy, agriculture, and water.

description: A field using GIS, remote sensing, and spatial modeling to map and analyze land use, environmental change, infrastructure, and human activity across scales.

name: Perceptual Evaluation and Human-Computer Interaction
description: A field focused on assessing how humans perceive and interact with digital systems, including interfaces, visual displays, and sensory feedback.

name: Artificial Tissue Growth and Regenerative Medicine
description: The development of lab-grown tissues and organs using stem cells, biomaterials, and bioreactors to treat injuries and diseases and reduce reliance on organ transplants.

description: A theoretical and observational field that models the origin, structure, and evolution of the universe, including dark energy, cosmic inflation, and large-scale structure formation.

description: A policy domain focused on redesigning social protection systems to ensure fairness, accessibility, and responsiveness to vulnerable populations, including the elderly and Indigenous communities.

description: The development of plant varieties and farming practices that enhance survival and productivity under water-limited conditions, supporting food security in arid regions.

name: Large-Scale Image Sensors and High-Resolution Imaging
description: The design and deployment of sensors capable of capturing high-resolution, high-dynamic-range images across vast areas, used in astronomy, environmental monitoring, and surveillance.

name: Predictive Modeling Software and AI-Driven Forecasting
description: The use of machine learning, statistical models, and simulation tools to forecast trends in climate, health, finance, and social systems with high accuracy and adaptability.

name: Fish Market Safety and Food Quality Assurance
description: A field focused on ensuring the safety, quality, and traceability of fish and seafood products from harvest to market, including pathogen control and consumer protection.

name: Communication Scheduling Analysis and Network Optimization
description: A domain focused on optimizing the timing, frequency, and routing of communication in networks to improve efficiency, reduce latency, and ensure reliability.

name: Transport Environments and Urban Mobility Systems
description: A systems-level study of how transport infrastructure, vehicles, and policies shape urban environments, including safety, equity, and environmental impact.

name: Climate System Prediction and Long-Term Modeling
description: The use of complex models to simulate and predict long-term climate trends, including temperature, precipitation, and extreme events, to inform adaptation and mitigation strategies.

name: Women in Work and Gender Equity
description: A policy and research domain focused on advancing gender equity in employment, leadership, and workplace culture through targeted interventions and structural reforms.

name: Liquidity Constraints and Financial Market Stability
description: A financial analysis domain examining the flow of funds in markets and institutions, with a focus on identifying and mitigating liquidity risks during crises.

name: Laser Additive Manufacturing and 3D Printing
description: A manufacturing technology using lasers to build complex parts layer by layer, with applications in aerospace, medicine, and sustainable construction.

name: Historical Language Research and Linguistic Evolution
description: A field studying the development, variation, and use of languages over time, including dialects, language contact, and sociolinguistic change.

name: Global Health Policy Guidance and Disease Forecasting
description: A domain focused on developing international health policies and predictive models to address pandemics, antimicrobial resistance, and global disease outbreaks.

name: Distributed Recycling Networks and Circular Economy
description: A system-level approach to managing waste and resource recovery through decentralized, community-based, and technology-enabled recycling networks.

name: Predictive Reliability and System Failure Analysis
description: A field focused on predicting the failure of complex systems (e.g., infrastructure, vehicles, software) using data, modeling, and real-time monitoring to improve safety and maintenance.

name: Heavy Metal Concentration Analysis and Environmental Toxicity
description: A field focused on detecting, quantifying, and assessing the environmental and health impacts of heavy metals in soil, water, and biological systems.

name: Hypothalamic Neural Circuits and Neuroendocrine Regulation
description: A neuroscience field studying the brain circuits in the hypothalamus that regulate hormones, stress, metabolism, and behavior through interactions with the endocrine system.

description: A field using genomic and epigenetic data to predict an individual's physical traits, disease susceptibility, and response to treatments.

description: A field using astronomical observations and simulations to identify and study the formation and evolution of ancient star systems and galaxies.

description: A field focused on increasing agricultural output through advanced farming techniques, biotechnology, and data-driven decision-making.

description: A field focused on the health, social, and cognitive challenges of older adults, including chronic disease, mental health, and care access.

name: Lab-Based Assays and Experimental Validation
description: A core scientific practice involving controlled experiments and analytical tests to validate hypotheses and technologies in a laboratory setting.

name: Photoelectron Emission Spectroscopy and Surface Analysis
description: A technique used to analyze the electronic structure and chemical composition of surfaces and thin films using photoemission methods.

name: Reference Material Development and Calibration
description: A field focused on creating standardized materials used to calibrate instruments and validate analytical methods across scientific and industrial applications.

name: Operator Performance and Human Factors
description: A field focused on understanding and improving human performance in complex systems, including industrial, medical, and transport environments.

name: First Nations Students and Indigenous Education
description: A field focused on improving educational outcomes and access for First Nations and Torres Strait Islander students through culturally responsive teaching and community engagement.

name: National Security Strategy and Defence Innovation
description: A domain focused on developing and implementing national security policies and technologies to protect critical infrastructure and populations.

name: Catch Allocation and Fisheries Management
description: A field focused on the equitable and sustainable distribution of fish catch through scientific, economic, and policy-based frameworks.
keywords: SESSF (Southern and Eastern Scalefish and Shark Fishery)

name: Risk Prioritization and Hazard Assessment
description: A systematic approach to identifying, evaluating, and ranking risks to inform decision-making in health, environment, and infrastructure.

name: Thyroid Hormone Signalling and Endocrine Regulation
description: A field studying the molecular and physiological mechanisms of thyroid hormone action in metabolism, development, and disease.

name: Policy Scenario Analysis and Strategic Planning
description: A field using modeling and simulation to explore potential future policy outcomes and develop adaptive strategies for complex systems.

name: Statistical Modeling Platforms and Data Science
description: A domain focused on developing and applying statistical and machine learning models to extract insights from complex, high-dimensional datasets.

name: Multi-Scale Imaging and High-Resolution Visualization
description: A field combining imaging techniques across scales—from atomic to ecosystem—to visualize complex structures and processes in biological and environmental systems.

name: Data-Driven Biological Inference and Systems Biology
description: A field using large-scale data to infer biological mechanisms, pathways, and network dynamics in living systems.

name: Customer Perceptions and Market Feedback
description: A field focused on understanding consumer attitudes, preferences, and behaviours to improve product design and service delivery.

name: Noisy Quantum Environments and Quantum Error Correction
description: A field focused on understanding and mitigating errors in quantum systems due to environmental noise, enabling more reliable quantum computation.

name: Adaptive Structures and Smart Materials
description: A field focused on designing materials and systems that can change their shape, properties, or function in response to environmental stimuli.

name: Trophic Reconstruction and Ecosystem Dynamics
description: A field focused on reconstructing food webs and trophic relationships in ecosystems using ecological and biological data.

name: Critical Infrastructure Management and Resilience
description: A field focused on protecting and maintaining essential infrastructure (e.g., energy, water, transport) against disruptions and natural or human threats.

name: Improving Humanitarian Coordination and Crisis Response
description: A field focused on enhancing coordination among agencies during humanitarian crises to improve aid delivery and response effectiveness.

name: Wound Healing Simulation and Tissue Regeneration
description: A field using computational and biological models to simulate wound healing and tissue repair processes for medical and engineering applications.

name: Global Physics Collaborations and Open Science
description: A field promoting international scientific collaboration in physics through shared data, open access, and joint research initiatives.

name: Genetic Intervention Design and Gene Editing
description: A field focused on designing and applying genetic interventions, including CRISPR, to correct disease-causing mutations and improve traits.

name: Residential Equity and Housing Policy
description: A field focused on ensuring fair access to safe, affordable, and sustainable housing for all communities, especially marginalized groups.

name: Fishing as a Public Health Intervention
description: A field exploring how fishing and aquaculture can contribute to public health through nutrition, employment, and community well-being.
keywords: fishing as a public health intervention

name: Accent-Based Discrimination and Linguistic Bias
description: A field studying the social and institutional impacts of accent-based discrimination in education, employment, and public services.

name: Historical Medicine and Traditional Healing
description: A field studying historical medical practices and traditional healing systems to inform modern healthcare and cultural understanding.

name: Wireless System Architecture and Communication Networks
description: A field focused on designing and optimizing wireless communication systems for efficiency, coverage, and security in diverse environments.

name: Living Evidence and Community-Based Knowledge
description: A field focused on integrating lived experiences and community knowledge into research and policy, especially in Indigenous and rural contexts.

name: National Interests and Geopolitical Strategy
description: A field analyzing how national policies and interests influence international relations, security, and global development.

name: Fossil Site Survey and Paleoenvironmental Reconstruction
description: A field focused on identifying, mapping, and interpreting fossil sites to reconstruct ancient environments and evolutionary history.

name: Microstructure-Guided Alloy Design and Materials Science
description: A field using microstructural analysis to guide the design of advanced alloys with optimized mechanical and thermal properties.

name: Crowdsourced Annotation and Citizen Science
description: A field leveraging public participation to annotate data, validate findings, and expand research reach in environmental, health, and cultural domains.

name: Earth's Oxygenation and Atmospheric Evolution
description: A field studying the historical changes in Earth's oxygen levels and their impact on life, climate, and biogeochemical cycles.

name: Rapid CO2 Conversion and Carbon Utilization
description: A field focused on converting CO2 into useful chemicals, fuels, or building materials using catalytic and biological processes.

name: Networked Counterpublics and Digital Activism
description: A field studying how digital networks form alternative publics to challenge dominant narratives and promote marginalized voices.

name: Compact Spectrometers and Portable Analytical Devices
description: A field focused on developing small, low-cost, and field-deployable spectrometers for real-time chemical and biological analysis.

name: Particle Discovery and High-Energy Physics
description: A field focused on detecting and studying subatomic particles using accelerators and detectors to understand fundamental forces and matter.

name: Wildlife Disease Management and Zoonotic Risk
description: A field focused on monitoring, preventing, and managing diseases in wildlife populations to reduce the risk of zoonotic transmission.

name: Event Invitations and Social Interaction Dynamics
description: A field studying how social events and invitations influence human interaction, community building, and digital engagement.

name: Noncommutative Geometry and Advanced Mathematical Frameworks
description: A theoretical field using noncommutative geometry to model physical systems and quantum phenomena beyond classical mathematics.

name: Scalable Sensing Architectures and Sensor Networks
description: A field focused on designing large-scale, distributed, and intelligent sensor networks capable of real-time monitoring and data fusion.

name: Ore-Bearing Sedimentary Rocks and Mineral Exploration
description: A field focused on identifying and extracting valuable minerals from sedimentary rock formations through geophysical and geochemical methods.

name: Interferometric Instrumentation and Precision Measurement
description: A field focused on using interferometry to achieve ultra-precise measurements of distance, shape, and phase in scientific and industrial applications.

name: Educational Tools and Learning Technologies
description: A field focused on developing and evaluating tools and platforms to enhance teaching, learning, and student engagement.

name: Rotor Burst Safety and Mechanical Failure Analysis
description: A field focused on preventing and analyzing catastrophic mechanical failures in rotating systems, such as turbines and motors.

name: Gas-Solids Interactions and Fluidized Bed Systems
description: A field focused on understanding and optimizing interactions between gases and solid particles in industrial processes like combustion and catalysis.

name: Multi-Scale Imaging and Biological Visualization
description: A field combining imaging techniques across scales to visualize biological structures and processes in real time.

name: Australian Energy Efficiency and Sustainable Power
description: A field focused on improving energy efficiency and transitioning to sustainable power sources in Australia’s energy sector.

name: Culturally Appropriate Methodology and Indigenous Research
description: A field focused on developing research methods that respect and incorporate Indigenous knowledge, values, and protocols.

name: Taste and Odour Control in Water and Food
description: A field focused on managing and eliminating unpleasant taste and odour in water, food, and environmental samples.
